input_text:
Job Title: Software Engineer II

Location: Cincinnati, OH

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
The Software Engineer performs software development work on applications primarily using Java/JEE, EJB, JPA and JSF, frontend and backend solutions, OO-Design, JAVA architectures and SQL Server database programming knowledge (SQL). Software Engineers work in small team sizes (3-5) on projects which run from 9-18 months in duration. Engineers are expected to be self-starters who can learn on their own and work to help train other members of their team in their areas of expertise.

Responsibilities

Undertake the delivery of a defined part of a project, including design, implementation, testing, integration (in-house and on-site) and documentationDevelop and test software in accordance with design requirementsGuarantee the compliances of the QA rules and guidelinesContribute to the definition of project designs and the project development process, as requestedAdhere to the appropriate design strategies and development methodologies, as defined by the Software Development Manager and Company quality proceduresProvide after-hours support on a rotating basis, to address customer issues that are reported after normal business hoursFully document all requirements definition, design, implementation and testing to the required standards

Application Requirements

BS degree in Computer ScienceGood IT experience in SQL ServerUnderstanding of real time programming, relational database concepts and architectureJava/JEE, EJB, JPA and JSF, both frontend and backend solutions, OO-Design and JAVA architectures Proven track record with SQL, preferably in SQL Server.Experience with application servers, preferably WebLogic.Professional experience in software development and software project business - min. 3 yearsâ€™ experience in similar capacityKnowledge in Warehouse Management Systems (WMS), logistics processes and interaction with material handling automation system is desirable

About Swisslog

Swisslog is shaping the #future of #intralogistics. As part of the KUKA Group, we are at the forefront of technology that is changing the world. Serving some of the biggest and most exciting brands across the globe, we're a team of 2,000 professionals and 50 nationalities, working together to transform intralogistics with smart minds and fresh perspectives. With our flexible, #robotic and #data-driven automated solutions, we are powering the supply chain and taking the industry forward. #JoinOurTeam and bring ideas to life!

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
